Trial_Design.evidence: They were either assigned treatment using a BD group or a control group that received hydrostatic dilation.

Participants.evidence: The subjects included in this study were all patients with chronic renal failure and required radio-cephalic arteriovenous fistula surgery for the first time and had not received dialysis before.

Intervention.evidence: They were either assigned treatment using a BD group or a control group that received hydrostatic dilation.

Objective.evidence: To investigate the effect of dilating small blood vessels using a balloon dilation (BD) technique on the occurrence of radio-cephalic autogenous arteriovenous fistulas in terms of patency, blood flow, and vein diameter (VD).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary patency at 1 year for the experimental group was 61.9% compared to 11.1% for the control group ( P = .045).

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 22 patients were enrolled in the balloon dilatation group and 20 patients in the control group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The primary patency at 1 year for the experimental group was 61.9% compared to 11.1% for the control group ( P = .045).
